intro: Calamagrostis tashiroi subsp. sikokiana, commonly known as the Japanese silver grass, is a perennial grass native to Japan. It features slender, silver-blue foliage that turns a striking coppery color in the fall. The plant produces delicate, feathery plumes that add ornamental value to gardens. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Its upright growth habit and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for landscaping and native plant gardens.
